Some may suggest that Benatar is being overly negative and unappreciative of the fact that levels of extreme poverty have fallen. It may also be pointed out that the global poor have enjoyed other gains, including improvements in health and reductions in mortality rates.
8 It is also often claimed that the poor have benefited from advancements in democracy and freedom. For example, it is not infrequent for mainstream news journals to celebrate the rising number of parliamentary democracies in Africa,
9 or to suggest that the internet and new mobile technologies have empowered the global poor,
10 or that economic globalisation has extended economic freedom and opportunities to all people.
11 In short, the global poor are not just better off, but also healthier and freer.
